Reviews.Title: “Functional but central location”
Reviews.Author: penangnite
Reviews.Content: I knew what I wanted when looking for a hotel - central location. For the price, Hotel Delle Regioni fits that like a glove. Its around a 5-10 min walk to the Trevi Fountain and about 10 mins to the Spanish Steps. Everything else I came across given this proximity to key locations would be much more expensive. Furthermore, considering that I was looking for something purely functional - knew that we would be out for most of the day from after breakfast to after dinner, we didnt need something more except for a nice comfortable bed in a clean room. If this is what you are looking for, this hotel may also be for you. The pros: 1) central location - 5-10 mins walk to Trevi Fountain; 10 mins to Spanish Steps, 15mins to Termini, 15-20 mins to Roman Forum. 2) very friendly staff - everyone we came across were friendly and speak English 3) room is clean - very small hotel - only 11 rooms so that probably helps maintain standards. 4) clean toilets - not too many amenities - soap, packet shampoo, hair dryer The cons: 1) small room - rooms are tiny - dont bring a big suitcase - if you have a regular carryon bag, that would work 2) small breakfast area - 3 tables seating 6 so if you are arriving the same time as other guests, you might have to wait or opt to have breakfast in your room 3) small breakfast selection - croissants, bread, donuts, yoghurt, cake and coffee of your choice. Its ideal for those who just want a place to sleep thats quite central. Dont expect more and you will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but don't expect comfort”
Reviews.Author: GAGuyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I would give this place a 2.5 rating because it is located so close to both Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps; a quick 5 minute walk to either (which are in opposite directions btw). Also, there is a metro station close by so you have quick access. The people at the desk are very nice and helpful even to us ugly Americans. Breakfast was a good selection of fresh baked goods (not to be confused with homemade) and they can make a wide range of hot drinks. There is free wi-fi in the common area. These are the good points. However, the walls are paper thin and you can hear every little noise. In our case, that was really annoying because we were close to the lobby and right next to the staff's toilet. I'll leave the rest to you. The bed lumpy and my back tightened up so bad that I could hardly bend over to tie my shoes. As can be seen by the photos, the shower is smaller than a phone booth and if your a big or tall person is it hard to get in and out. All things considered, I would spend a little more and stay in a nicer hotel. There are plenty of higher end hotels in the same area so you have several other options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with the nice location”
Reviews.Author: Krolya
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Small, but everything needed is there. Very good location - close to the historical centre. Good shopping streets and bars next to the hotel. Quite safe. Good price-quality rate. Very friendly personell. The rooms are a bit too small, but clean and fine for those ones, who anyway spend more time out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: metteling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small with tiny rooms. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable to rest after a hard day enjoying the beautiful city. It is good that the hotel is small, because you can hear almost everything from the corridore.The location is very comfortable for sightseeing as many of the must to see places are reached by foot and the metro is close. The breakfast is very basic but they make good coffee and cappucino to start the day. There are lot of good restaurants nearby to have a nice lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Its simple,but is very well located”
Reviews.Author: jburger52
Reviews.Content: Its is a simple hotel,with small rooms.Very well located,with a friendly staff. I just go to the room to sleep,therefore was PERFECT for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie G
Reviews.Content: This little hotel (10 rooms) was a pleasure. The staff was wonderful - very nice and helpful. The location was perfect - 4 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. The room rates we a true value. This is not a fancy hotel - but it was superb for busy tourists. Very clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CristianaM2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just few minutes away from Fontana di Trevi. It is a small hotel with only 11 rooms and it is perfect for a city break. The rooms are a little bit smaller than they appear to be on the official website; the breakfast area is small (only 3 little tables); the breakfast is very limited. But all together – for a short trip – it’s a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Delle Regioni for two nights and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Located just a street away from Piazzia Barberini, you can walk pretty much anywhere you want by day and by night. The breakfast in the morning was standard cookies, juice, yogurt, coffee, tea etc. and there were also very good brioche. The rooms don't allow for huge bags or lots of walking as they are small, but the bathrooms are very spacious. As a couple travelling for pleasure it was everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Delle Regioni”
Reviews.Author: Trevor2929
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in this hotel. The location is good for walking to all the main attractions and the Metro is 400m away. The hotel is on a very busy noisy street , however our room had two sets of windows which kept out the noise. Our double room was small but adequate , just room for the bed and a desk and small wardrobe ; no chairs. Breakfast was adequate continental breakfast. Staff very helpful. A good location and adequate room , good value for the price in Central Rome

Reviews.Title: “Three and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: JRo44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely adequate and in a good location. We loved Rome and found we could pretty much walk to most of the sites from here. It's close to the Metro stop (Barberini) and the staff was very helpful and we loved the restaurants they recommended that were off the beaten path. They even helped us with bus routes to get to some of the sites on our list. Hotel and rooms are clean and the breakfast pastries and cappucino were definitely adequate for what we needed. The room was small, but to be expected in Europe in general. The only real issue for us was a short ceiling in a very small stand-up shower which made it diffcult for my 6'4" husband to use, but we made due just fine. The staff was very nice and I would recommend this as a good value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happyinrome888
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to explore Rome as VERY close to all attactions and sights. Staff VERY friendly and breakfast was lovely. Room was clean and tidy. Couldn't ask for more for this price. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JoMcElvenny
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel may not be 5 star luxury it has both value for money, cleanliness, free wifi and a brilliant location on its side. We stayed for 4 nights in late August 2011 and it was the perfect base to explore Rome for the first time. Within easy walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona, as well as the main shopping streets. Also on easy transport links for both the underground (easiest way to get to the Collesseaum) and the buses (best way to zigzag on a couple to the Vatican and to our favourite eating and aperitif spots in Trastavere- use main piazzas such as Piazza Argentina as directional guides) Rooms had AC but the control was half hidden in the curtains. Staff were really pleasant and breakfast typical European sweet treats and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great night stay - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mrn411
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Delle Regioni in July. The hotel is in a perfect location right between the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It is a smaller hotel but served its purpose for us. The room was clean, breakfast was great, staff was friendly, Air Conditioning was working - what more could you ask. I'd recommend asking for a room closer to the lobby so that you can take advantage of the free wifi in the bedroom. We wern't able to get a signal in the room but had fast service in the lobby. Overall - great stay! Rome in August is a lot of fun. Just double what you plan on spending as Rome is very very expensive - and the exchange rate hurt even more. A typical dinner for my wife and I (bottle of wine, two 1st course dishes, breshetta) would cost $70 amerian dollars. Oh well - when in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: We just want to say thanks to the staff at Hotel Delle Regioni for making our stay perfect. We stayed over 4 days, early July. We had our 21 month old boy with us. The hotel is perfectly located, a stones throw from the Trevi Fountain. The Spanish Steps is also close by. The room was ideal, good air-con, cot and bedding lovely and clean. Nice shower and clean towels daily. Breakfast was nice. Absolutely no complaints. The staff were great, always very helpful with giving advice re places to see, eat and how to get there, providing free maps too. They even booked some tours for us and arranged for us to be collected from the Hotel door - ideal, especially with a young child. They recommended a restaurant nearby, slightly off the main tourist walkway to the Trevi Fountain and it was lovely, felt like proper Italy and not just some tourist-filled restaurant. A little tip re getting to the Hotel from the airport if using a budget airline is to get the shuttle with one of the companies, only 4 euros, which drops you at the Termini (main train station). Take the Metro (underground train) from within the Termini and get off at Barberini, which i think is only a stop or two away. The Hotel is closeby but it cannot be seen from the main road (Via Tretone I think it is) as the entrance is up a side street. I think there is a green lit sign 'HOTEL' sticking out which can be seen. When you see that you know that you've found it. Thanks again to all the staff for a great holiday. Kev, Steph & Will-i-am !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: catladyfromPA18055
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on our honeymoon at this hotel. Positives: clean, friendly staff, great coffee, affordable, good location, quiet, charming, and air conditioning worked well Negatives: very tiny shower- smaller than the one in our stateroom on the cruise ship! everything (but the bed) was a little on the small side, but we are small people, and that's Europe! (Plus it is a ten room hotel, so it is not like the are accommodating large crowds). Also, the toilet hard hard time flushing properly. Overall, this hotel cost us 400 Euros for 4 nights, which is a great deal for the location, which is near the Spanish steps, the Barberini metro stop, and the Trevi fountain. The staff was very helpful in trying to locate our lost camera. It never did get found, but they called the taxi company a few times for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central hotel, would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Tranqu1lity
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading some previous Tripadvisor reviews. As others have said, it is in a good, central location close to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The entrance is located on a road just off the Via del Tritone and is close to Barberini Metro Station, buses and ATMs. The room itself was small but very clean, with an en-suite (shower was VERY small!), air-con and a flat screen tv. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable and all spoke very good English. Breakfast was ok, though no more than you would expect - croissants, rolls, cereal, etc. - and the coffee was good! Just a little reminder, as from 1 January 2011, a city tax has been added to all hotel stays and is per person, per night (up to a maximum of 10 nights). For our stay, this added another 8 Euros to the price of the room and we were told it had to be paid in cash!!! However, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dozier13
Reviews.Content: The room is decent, and the location is great. You can walk to a lot of things, and there's a subway and bus stop right nearby. When you're in Rome, you shouldn't be at your hotel much so if you're only concerned with seeing the sights and not location, you could stay along the metro line in another part of town for less money and be fine. The trains and buses get you everywhere pretty easily so there's an option to save money if you don't care about your hotel's surroundings. Overall, we had a great stay here, but I would think about staying somewhere further away for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, good location”
Reviews.Author: ducati749girl
Reviews.Content: During my trip I stayed in 3 different Hotels in Rome. This hotel was fine for the price i was able to get it at, quite comfortable and a reasonably good location half way down Via del Tritone from Termini Station and only one or two blocks from Piazza Barberini. Entrance is on the side laneway and It is up one flight of stairs. The staff were very nice and helpful, rooms were ok - you get used to the small bathrooms....they are all the same vying for space so you just deal with it. I did find most mattresses were quite firm throughout most of my 3 week stay throughout Italy and these were among the firmest but when walking all day around Rome I found i slept anyway! WIFI was only accessible in the dining area which is quite small but there was only one other person there in the evening. I requested an earlier breakfast time than normal to meet a tour and this was not a problem at all and brought to my room. Typical basic breakfast - coffee, juice, croissant, jam etc. It was ok and enough but have had better and fresher. I did try to book in again for a week later however the rate jumped by double and i did not think it was worth the full price however it was leading into summer and the high season but there were still deals available at other similar small family hotels. Would stay again for one or two nights if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: pompeyrog
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the fact that the entrance to the hotel is a narrow doorway down a cobbled side street. This is a traditional Rome city centre hotel ina great location .The staff provide fantastic service,always with a smile, and the rooms are small but very comfortable.The shower in room 8 was excellent, the air conditioning was very efficient and quiet, and the bed was really comfortable.The continental style breakfast was very fresh, with excellent tea and coffee.Check in is supposed to be from 2pm, but although we arrived early, about 11am, our room was ready in 10 minutes, and we saw this happen with another couple the following day.The standard of personal service was much better than we have received in 5 star hotels.Th.ey also arranged our transfer to the airport at a price cheaper than we saw on the internet Highly recommended and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cpcole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location.and very comfortable. The best thing is the excellent customer service provided by the hotel staff. We enjoyed our stay and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: MissCocoWestbrookCt
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stop for the night in Rome after flying into the city as we would be leaving for Sienna the next day. Mainly we needed a place located close to the Metro so we could get around quickly to see a few main sights during our 24 hrs there. We were right near the Barberini stop and in very close proximity to the Trevi Fountain, where there wer wonderful places to eat at night. The hotel is very small but the room and bathroom were quite adequate and clean and the price reasonable for Rome. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The spot was just perfect for a day or two stop in Rome .

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly management”
Reviews.Author: kbullard78
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel steps from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps at a fantastic price for Central Rome. Don't expect frills, but the hotel is clean, the rooms are big enough (with large beds), and the staff was super!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nursey14
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely wee hotel, in a perfect location close to the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. The rooms are small, but perfectly suitable for what we needed, after all, we hardly spent any time in there! Rooms are a little tired decor wise, but spotlessly clean. Our room was cleaned and fresh clean towels supplied daily. However the shower is small and if you are particularly tall then this may be a problem. As for noise, Rome is a busy city, so there's no escaping that no matter where you stay! The bed was comfortable with extra pillows available if needed. There was also a really helpful guide in the room detailing local attractions and prices which we found very helpful. Reception staff were all very fiendly and helpful. Breakfast was not what we're used to, but, when in Rome! lots of restaurants available close by and reasonable in comparison to those close to the attractions. If you want a clean hotel in a good location, then the hotel delle regioni is for you. We would definately stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: RosieFifeGirl
Reviews.Content: We were in a superior room (20) so had a bit more space which is needed with Italian room sizes. The location is great and the staff are as helpful as previous reviewers say, even supply free brollies for the rainy days. Would have no hesitation recommending for a good, basic, warm hotel. However, with just a little more attention it could be a great wee gem. As we were on Via Tritone side it was noisy but that bothered me less than the poor sound insulation between bathrooms. Didn't appreciate being wakened before 6 am two mornings whilst people had their showers for early departures. The noise was horrendous, far, far worse than any road noise - more like having your ear snuggled up to a vacuum cleaner. The other issue was how uncomfortable the bed is. I like a hard bed so shrugged off previous reviewers comments, but this was like sleeping on the floor and most mornings I woke up with a numb hip. My last gripe is the breakfast - not the quantity as you could have as much as you want and was constantly topped up. However, whilst I don't consider myself a health nut, I think the breakfast more suitable for a 10yr old. Very sweet juice drink, sweet cornflakes, sweet unidentifiable yoghurt and a huge pile of pastries and biscuits. How I longed for a bit of muesli or fresh fruit. Still the carb heavy top up does keep you going for major sightseeing. We also took advantage of the hotel's taxi for return to airport with no hassle and it even arrived early. So despite the gripes would recommend as long as these issues aren't important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...no more, no less than needed”
Reviews.Author: schwartzy886
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed a week at the Hotel Delle Regioni with my girlfriend and couldn't have been happier with my choice. The reviews are true--the location is fantastic...right on a side street (charming in itself) off the busy Via del Tritone. Around the corner from the Barberini subway station. Walking distance to the historic center. The room size was to be expected. Basically a bed, a desk, a closet, bathroom. But you really don't need more room considering you are in Rome so you're basically in your hotel to sleep at night. The staff was very friendly and accommodating--no problems there. Breakfast was good enough for us--there are only two tables in the breakfast area (but it was never crowded...plus you can get room service if it bothers you). Cappuccinos obviously were delicious plus the assortment of pastries. Nothing too fancy but enough to fill you up before lunch and nice to be included. All in all--would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in the Heart of Old Rome”
Reviews.Author: pensfan48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in February. First off, the staff was amazing! They did everything they could to make our stay better. The hotel is perfectly located, we walked to all of the tourist destinations, and when we were tired at night it was a quiet quick stroll to the Trevi fountain or Spanish Steps. The rooms are on the small side, but we were there just to sleep and drop stuff off as we kept touring. i would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but good value, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: EU27Traveller
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its central location - close to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps and with easy access to other sights via the nearby metro station Piazza Barberini. It also offers good value for central Rome hotels. Located up a cobbled side street just off the busy Via del Tritone, the hotel is rather hidden way. However, first looks can be deceptive and I found it a friendly family-run hotel. My room was clean and had everything I needed but it was small - the double bed took up most of the space although a cupboard, table and chair were also squeezed in together with a ensuite. As I was out and about all day that was not a problem. The breakfast was adequate - the coffee was delicious but the choice of bread/croissants etc was rather limited. The breakfast room was small and insufficient to seat all the guests - but you could order breakfast in your room at no charge. So, a friendly centrally located hotel offering good value 3 star accommodation - but with small rooms (or at least mine was).

Reviews.Title: “Just a few steps to the Trevi”
Reviews.Author: OnmywaytoParis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many nicer hotels but also many not as nice hotels. The price was right overall, the hotel was clean and we slept well but who wouldn't after 10+hours on your feet walking around Rome each day. Close to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps and also to the subway in nearby Piazza Barberini. Nice breakfast for light eaters and good suggestions from the staff. We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Oz2_10
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend this hotel. The location can't be beat and the rooms were very clean. Bed was surprisingly comfortable. Breakfast was simple but delicious. Staff were very nice - good choice in expensive Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for price sensitive tourists”
Reviews.Author: PARIS_IOANNOU
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome are generally expensive. Compared to the general term this hotel is relatively cheap but it could be cheaper. Very good location and believe me this is important. Rooms were decent and clean. Breakfast was adequate. A plus is the staff willingness to help and their freindliness. If you are looking a place where you can just have a nice night sleep, take a shower but spend most of the daytime outside, this is the right place. On the negative side, the hotel looks poor especially from the outside. With some smart ideas, it could look better.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and comfy home base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: reedlj
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful, the location excellent and central, and the room was comfy, quiet and private. It was very nice to have a little refuge from the chaos of Rome...and the included breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary5432
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel to be very nice. The location was wonderful and the rooms were comfortable. The staff was absolutely the best, they were very friendly, most spoke english and were very helpful. They helped set up some tours for us and directed us to many attractions. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy street, excellent location between Fontana di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna”
Reviews.Author: aDaf
Reviews.Content: Small room, smaller shower. Location - Right between Fontana di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna, next to many bus stops and Barberini metro station. Noise - Right on the three-lane Tritone street with many busses, motorcycles and cars. Room has a double window which reduces the noise greatly but not entirely. Still it didn't bother our sleep. In-room safe - the tiniest we've ever seen. Could barely fit a camera in, but will hold your passports and money. Internet - free, fast Wi-Fi in hotel 'lobby'. There is an internet-caffe right next to the hotel if you need it. Breakfast - Nothing much there - pastries, cornflakes, yogurt and a mean-looking coffee machine (we don't drink). Staff - Was helpful with information. The room had a very informative booklet prepared by the hotel on the area, close-by bus lines and restaurants. TV - Italian only.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: LOKCentralNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel - small (11 rooms I think), breakfast included and excellent internet (we coul not get internet in the Tuscany region and no problems here). The rooms and bathroom are small but very clean and comfortable. Very convenient - close to trains and you can walk to everything. We will stay here if ever in Rome again. Car service is available to FCO airport for 40 Euro - excellent value and great service!!! The staff is very nice - you'll really like it!

Reviews.Title: “A "small" diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: lucipie21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 4 day stay at Hotel Delle Regioni. The location is perfect. A short walk to most of the main tourist attractions. The hotel management was excellent, always friendly and ready to help. The breakfast was always fresh and what I expected. The hotel is very clean and the size of the room was adequate. Just a nice place to hang your hat. If I return to Rome, I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Delle Regioni again.

Reviews.Title: “Booked based on reviews - ideal location but small small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dannyw35
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome with the wife. We stayed at Delle Regioni based on the many reviews we read online - we expected a small room but probably not as small as it actually was. We barely had enough room to move around the bed with our suitcases in there too...bathroom was sufficient - shower again was on the small size (we're not large people but it was tight) Breakfast was again ok - the chocolate croissants were lovely :) Was happy with the cleanliness of the room throughout - made the stay a little more comfortable Staff were friendly and helpful Location was ideal - walking distance to all the main sites - even a walk to the Vatican was not too bad - carefully plan your routes and you will capture alot of wonderful sites

Reviews.Title: “nice, friendly hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: lfbourton402
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, room was comfortable, slightly on the small side, but suitable for my needs, as when in Rome i do not believe you spend much time in your hotel room. breakfast is provided and consists of pastries, bread, yoghurts, cheese, ceral, coffee and juice. hotel is suited in a central location and is easy to walk to most places, the trevi fountain and the Spanish steps being the closest, and many other sights near by. hotel staff are friendly and welcoming, there is an internet cafe right next door, also restaurants are a short walk away. the street noise was quite loud from my room as was close to reception, this may not be the case in all rooms, but was only a small problem. the hotels provides towels and some basics essentials in in the bathroom. the room had air con, mini bar and a safe, room service is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosanne_618
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Delle Regioni for one week. The location of this hotel is excellent, just a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. There is an internet cafe next and a laudrette across the road. The staff were extremely warm, friendly and helpful. The only downside was that our room was on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly family run hotel which has all you need for your stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 255060Linda
Reviews.Content: From the beginning of our stay at the hotel we felt welcome and if we had any questions, friendly staff did not hesitate to help. The room was comfortable and serviced well daily, however at times we found the air conditioning struggled to keep the room cool. The location was fantastic and you were able to walk to all the major sites. Metro was also close to the hotel. Breakfast was a highlight for us, simple and provided what you required. Overall, our favourite hotel in Italy and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: LondonLaur
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely week long stay at the Hotel Delle Regioni. The location is within walking distance of all the sights of Rome. The room was basic but comfortable, a good size for Europe, and with all the necessary facilities such as a decent size fridge, powerful shower, AC, hairdryer etc. (but take your own toiletries). The room service menu was a delight and good value. The hotel staff were lovely and friendly and spoke fluent English, with someone always on the front desk. The breakfast was good, sitting in the little lounge area felt cosy and the freshly made to order coffee was lovely. All in all we had a great time at this small hotel. Also, make use of the hotel's shuttle service to and from the airport (it is around the same cost as getting the train, but is much easier and quicker).

Reviews.Title: “Superbly positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaMeeds
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Regioni is a small hotel with 10 rooms, ideally located for easy access to the Trevi fountain & Spanish Steps and only a small walk from the Pantheon and other main attrractions. The rooms were compact but spotless and the staff extremely helpful & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel find!”
Reviews.Author: tsperdue
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Can't say enough about the staff, awesome! Staff (thanks Marco!) helped us find our luggage at FCO, accommodated early breakfast and departure times, and told us about great, off the beaten track tourist sites. Nice extra: well stocked frig in room. Very clean and well maintained! Steps from Barberini Station, Great location to everything, yet on a side street, off Via de Tritone, so quiet at night. Small rooms, but expected in great old building in Europe. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fantastic location, ideal for Rome city break.”
Reviews.Author: jennythom
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, (and spoke very good english). The hotel is ideally located between the trevi fountain and the spanish steps and is "just" on one of the main roads, Via del Tritone. The rooms are fairly basic, but are everything you would need for a city break, very clean and nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Roma”
Reviews.Author: originalXfactor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here for the Rome portion of our Italy trip. We had done extensive searching and research here on tripadvisor and hotel websites to determine a cost effective, clean, and safe room for our brief stay. This hotel was only slightly more than a city block from the Barberini Metro stop, an easy walk with luggage if you are traveling around Italy via rail. The location is further sublime - all major sights in Rome are very close - we were able to walk everywhere from this hotel, even Vatican city was only 30min by foot. One thing we were not able to find within a block or two of the hotel, though, was a good restaurant or trattoria - we ate most meals down at Piazza Navona. There are a few little dining establishments 2 blocks away near the Spanish Steps, but the are not traditional Italian food for breakfast or lunch - think continental American. The hotel is 50' down a side street north of Via del Tritone; the exterior is not as sketch as one reviewer alluded to if you consider most little hotels in Rome - there are much sketchier establishments that we heard about or walked past. The hotel inside is spot on for the money. Desk staff is VERY helpful and the place was immaculate. Rooms are small, but lets face it - you're in Rome - you're not going to be hanging out in the room. Bed was sufficiently large, but the mattress was very thin and the springs were not that supportive. Bathroom was of decent size, but the shower stall was so narrow I had to turn off the water and open the mini-doors so I had room to soap up. The only other detracting thing would be the AC. Ours did not work at all. It blew luke-warm-cold air all night long; we had to open the windows on a sweltering and humid night. All in all for what we needed during our stay in Rome this was the perfect choice. 2 nights were only E238. That sounds like a lot, E119/night; however, all hotels in Rome are overly expensive. For the price, our needs, and the amount of time we actually spent in the hotel, this was exactly what we needed at a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: aktoeu
Reviews.Content: Location was great. It looked a little sketch from the outside, but looks were deceiving. The room was small, but comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and they spoke English perfectly. They offered a breakfast in a small breakfast area or delivered to your room. Nice air conditioning too for those warm Rome afternoons. I'd book again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LikeABigPizzaPie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delle Regioni for our final stay in Roma and chose it become of its location. This was perfect as we would walk out the front door and be right in the thick of historical Roma with its piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi fountain, great restaurant, caffes and shopping WALKING distance. The area is safe and clean, animated and we had a great time. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful. They have no problems helping with reservations for cars, travelling, day trips, etc. Something other hotels will not do. They will even negotiate a fair price from reservations. The room was clean, comfy and secure (safe in the room), we had a great night sleep and the only sad point was having to leave. Breakfast was a good start to the day. We will definitively return next time in Roma. Wonderful oasis in the middle of a beautiful historical city.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rparent
Reviews.Content: May wife and I stumbled on this great little spot and stayed 2 nights for 115 euro a night.. Perfect location to walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Vatican City and great shopping. The staff are fantastic, clean rooms and very good breakfast. The restaurant across the street we also a great find. Westland, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: melnel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Delle Regioni for 3 nights in May. The location is fantastic - we walked everywhere except the Vatican (and we took the subway which had a stop right by the hotel). The hotel staff is so helpful and gave us great dining recommendations for both lunch and dinner. Our first room was a little louder than we cared for due to street noise and they gladly moved us to another room while we were out for the day. Thanks for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “An excelent choise in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fruchtengarten
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, and VERY helpfull staff (with excellent tips for dinning and sightseeing, ask them!). This hotel is quite simple and rooms are not much big (including a shower not very confortable for people with more than 1,85m), but keep in mind that you´re just 5minutes from Piazza Spagna and Fontana de Trevi (walking!), and 2min from Barberini Metro Station. The breakfast are just fine and the cleanliness are impecable. But it´s a 3-star hotel, so remeber that there was no luxury... Definitively I recommend. After 5 days I can not imagine a better place to stay. Best Value.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Went above and beyond for us”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: We didn't get a chance to stay here as there was a horrible error with Orbitz (we'll never use them again) but the staff was very helpful in trying to contact Orbitz and working something out to find us another hotel near them. They didn't have to help us at all but they let us use their phone and helped up look up hotels and gave their personal reccomendation. They were honest about the other hotels and their locations and seemed like they genuinely cared about helping us find a place to stay. Many thanks to them and I can't wait to come back to Rome a 4th time and stay here. This would have been a great place to stay as its so close to all the sites...

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: gracebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very nice time. The rooms were small but spotlessly clean and the staff was very helpful. They gave us several good tips for eating out and they also arranged for the return to the airport very early in the morning. The beds were very comfortable and the water pressure for the shower was great. The only complaint was that my room faced the main street and the street noise was quite loud. I needed the windows open since it was too early (by law???) to turn on the air conditioner and it was too hot to close the window. But since I was exhausted from walking all around Rome during the day, it still didn't take long to fall asleep! I would certainly stay here again, but would see if I could get one of the rooms on the side street.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a great location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Italiaphile_7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day trip which turned into a nine day stay because of the volcano. We were lucky to be staying in this hotel where Viviana and her staff took great care of us, spending hours on the phone and internet checking flights and dealing with Alitalia on our behalf. Three times we checked out and went to the airport and twice had to return but Viviana reassured us that there would always be a room for us. The hotel is little but very good, well situated (5 mins from the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain, 2 mins from Barbarini Metro, and with the buses right outside), very clean and with the most helpful staff you could ever get. The rooms are comfortable and the shower has good pressure. The free breakfast is the usual cereal, rolls, pastries, cake, biscuits, orange juice and delicious cappuchinos. Viviana speaks excellant English, and the other staff make every effort to understand. Everyone is pleasant and cheerful. Despite the stress of not knowing when we would get home, we had a wonderful holiday and this was largely due to the staff at the hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Three Night in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Johnroma
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel delle Regioni everybody made us feel welcome.Its central to every thing metro with in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissally
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The rooms were very clean and tidy. The price included a breakfast which was very good. Staff were helpful. The hotel is quiet. As mentioned by numerous reviews of this hotel, the location was excellent. The hotel is located a short walk from a metro stop and also is almost adjacent to various bus routes. We felt that this hotel offered very good value for money due to the combination of a fair price and location. We would return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Location is unbeatable.”
Reviews.Author: ringostx02
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. Located within a stone throw of Bernini's Piazza, you have ready access to the Metro and 5 or 6 bus routes (we used 116 the most, which ran from St. Peter's Square at one extreme to the Borgehese on the other extreme). We purchased a Roma Pass as soon as we arrived from a Tobacci Shop, and the convenience of public transportation from this hotel was incredible. Of course, you are right by the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, so you can walk pretty much anywhere in center city (e.g. Pantheon). The staff was extremely helpful and welcoming. Although I struggled with the language, they were always patient and willing to work it out with me without making me feel stupid in the least. The free breakfast was pretty good (any coffee to order, bread, cheese, juice, water, etc). Note that there was not any hot breakfast or meats, but I was okay with that. The room was extremely clean. To be expected for this price and location, it is not remarkably spacious. However, I pretty much just went to the hotel to sleep and maybe wind down for one hour before hand, so this was not an issue in the least. Clean bathrooms, clean sheets, and hard floors (so no worries about a jenky carpet). It was great, I would highly recommend and plan to go back if I have the pleasure of visiting Rome in my future again. The only complain: the wireless internet did not reach my room. I had to go to the lobby to access the wireless; but it was fast and reliable for downloading my Rick Steves audio tours. Also, please note that to lock in promotional rates, you often have to pay in cash. I went during the off-season and locked in a rate of 76 Euro per night, but it got bumped up to 80 because I paid with credit card. Not a big deal; if I had really cared, I could have just walked to an ATM with the advanced knowledge. EXCELLENT value!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: organisedtraveller11
Reviews.Content: Great service from staff, very friendly and spoke English (and didn't laugh at our poor attempts of Italian!). Amazing location of hotel, short walk from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and lots of cafes, restaurants and bars nearby, as well as metro train stop at the Piazza Barberini (a 2 minute walk from the hotel). Pretty basic set up and small room, but location makes up for that. Hot shower with great water pressure - a small thing that rates highly when you're travelling in winter! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Endorse the positive reviews of other travellers”
Reviews.Author: Mick_and_Moose
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, ideally located for exploring the city, very friendly service - typified by our returning to find a rose in our room on my wife's birthday - the hotel had noticed when checking the passports. Only slight drawback was that room was on the smallish side, but so was the price. Great value, would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice low price hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlaFje
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights at this low price but very nice hotel. The staf was nice and the service was excellent. The rooms was not so big, but you dont spend much time at the room when you are in Rome. Hotel delle Regioni is close to everything you have to see, and we highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pitti_sing33
Reviews.Content: Clean , friendly and perfect for a couple of nights in Rome at a reasonable cost. A basic, but adequate breakfast.Spanish Steps just up the road, shops, restaurants and places of interest all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Even better location.”
Reviews.Author: lule19
Reviews.Content: We've only just got back from our stay at this hotel and were more than satisfied. Firstly i should mention that we booked this hotel through a popular webpage which stated that it was room only. This was not the case as we were told that breakfast was included with every room. Breakfast consisted of coffee (cappicino, espresso, tea, etc), orange juice, croissants, pastries, yoghurt, bread, jam, soft cheese, etc. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was small but comfortable and clean. But the best thing about this hotel was the location. It is just a short walk from the Trevi fountain and we stopped there every night on the way back from where ever we went. The pantheon, spanish steps and piazza navona are accessible by foot. If you want to visit the vatican it is easy to get to via the metro and the metro station is very close tot the hotel. The metro is also easy to navigate and tickets are simple to buy and well priced. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel delle Regioni + Viviana = Perfect Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: JVCVirginia_USA
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Rome and our third 'wonderful' stay at the Hotel delle Regioni. We orginally picked the hotel on our first visit in 1999 because we were budget conscious and wanted to be centrally located. The hotel did not disappoint. It is clean, safe, just minutes from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, and best of all, has a great staff, especially Viviana! I challenged Viviana every day for restaurant suggestions and she delivered with great recommendations. She was always eager to help and on top of it all, makes a great Capuccino! We look forward to coming to Rome again and staying at the hotel! Bravo Hotel delle Regioni! The Camacho's from Virginia, USA

Reviews.Title: “It is amazing hotel in a unique city!”
Reviews.Author: kamen_ina
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time there. We were for 5days in this hotel. The service was really great. If we take a holiday in Rome adain, we will definitely choose this hotel. The best holiday that we have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really appreciated hotel staff's great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MontrealGuest086
Reviews.Content: This small hotel vastly exceeded our expectations. It is definitely value-for-money given how centrally located it is. Our room was a generous size compared to other hotels we stayed at in Italy. The room was very clean upon our arrival and during our stay. It was 36'Celsius in Rome when we were there. The room was well air conditioned despite this heat wave. The breakfast was great - especially the croissants and fresh coffee. In addition to the above, I think this hotel's best asset is its helpful staff. Everyone was polite and helpful. The lady at the front desk even allowed us to check out late on our departure day. This was extremely helpful as it allowed us to shower before an overnight train back to Paris. I can't thank her enough!!!! Happy Guest from Montreal, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel delle Regioni...the Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: POOT69
Reviews.Content: My wife (Deborah), myself (Rod Kenas), our eldest daughter (Hanna) and her husband (Jonathan Roach)all traveled Europe for two weeks, starting in Germany, then to Switzerland and then Italy, i.e., saving the best for last! We stayed in small quaint hotels, hostels, etc., while backbacking, even on an overnight train from Bern to Florence. The Hotel delle Regioni is owned and operated by a young couple who were most accommodating, as well as their front desk, cleaning and 'breakfast' staff, ...in fact, the young woman who made my cappacino each morning was a master at such! I will stay there again the next time I'm in Rome, guaranteed! Respectfully, -Rod Kenas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: BDPIL
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with friendly stuff Great location - 5 min from metro, close to Trevy fountain, Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pumablucefalu
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is great, near the Spanish Steps, We could walk to everything we wanted to see.We were treated like one of the family.......

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Central to everything.”
Reviews.Author: J2uk
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Rome for her Birthday and we stayed in this Hotel which is situated about 400m from the Trevi Fountain. I would recommend it to any one looking for a central location as we walked everywhere. The staff were all very helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. Breakfast was fairly basic but it did the job. If i ever come back to Rome I will definitely stay here again. A couple of words of warning, watch out for the pickpockets on the Spanish Steps and around the Coliseum. Jeremy

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samahi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends at the end of April and we were pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Delle Regioni. The hotel was spotless, the rooms were small, but nicely furnished. The bathroom was small, but had a tiled shower with super strong water pressure and lots of hot water. It was about a five minute walk to the Trevi Fountain - we ended up just waking everywhere - great location. Obviously, being on a busy street there is the potential for traffic noise, but our room had double glazing and air conditioning and I slept really well - wasn't woken up by street noise at all. Breakfast was ok - nothing fancy. Great cappucino, and lovely croissants but that's about it. Best of all was the staff, who were friendly and helpful, greeted us by name, and organised transportation back to Ciampino for us. It was 10 Euro more than the standard rate, but we got to ride in comfort in a black mercedes, which was much more enjoyable than the regular taxi we used on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: pickles2006
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful with a terrific restaurant recommentation. But, the hotel hadn't paid its gas bill and we didn't have any air conditioning, had to open the window, on the first floor and listen to the extremely loud street sounds. Not exactly restful to weary travelers. They didn't offer to lower the bill so we moved out of the hotel early.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: kaboodle
Reviews.Content: We checked in at around midnight on our arrival and the nice desk person greeted us by name as if waiting up for us. It's a friendly, small hotel that is close to the spanish steps, the Trevi fountain and the metro. We found great restaurants nearby and loved the overall neighborhood. Our room was clean and very quiet and we were overall pleased with out stay. The room was small as are many of the hotels in Rome, the mattress was extremely hard and uncomfortable. I woke up constantly and could not get comfortable. The pillow was very firm and too hard...it gave me a stiff neck every night. The bathroom was fine, but the shower was so small, you could not bend over if you dropped the soap! Also, the shampoo provided is the type that comes in a foil package like ketchup...you have to rip it open and it is next to impossible with wet hands. There was a built in hair dryer that worked fine and that is always nice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Roma ti amo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel delivered a completely stress free stay from our arrival to our departure. The staff were all that you would expect in a quality hotel helpful, courteous, and friendly. The room was both comfortable and very clean and afforded a high calibre of good quality equipment. The hotel is well placed for all the major tourist sights and is surrounded by excellent eating facilities and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: weewhitedog
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a real find ideally located near all the main tourist sights in the centre of Rome. Don't be put off by it's side street location as it rates as one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The main reason for this is the excellent attitude of it's staff who are always happy to go that extra step to make your stay as comfortable as possible. It's small size is actually one of it's attractions, bringing with it a real quaintness summed up by the tiny breakfast area where they make probably the best cappuccino in the world. I'LL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Central and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last destination and we planned to be happy if we managed an average room. However, the Delle Regioni was quite above average. Room is big, bathroom is brand new and the staff was very nice. It is 2 blocks from the Metro line and in walking distance to everything. Good place for the money.....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and smack in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to the hotel three times now and always been very satisfied. Every time it gets better. Hotel location in Rome is excellent. The subway is close by but if you like to walk, you can do so from the hotel to ALL the fabulous tourist attractions in the Eternal City. The proprietor and staff are great people who go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Delle Regioni
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Tritone 94, 00187 Rome, Italy
